neighborhoods.name: Centro
neighborhoods.character: Madrid's historic heart featuring grand boulevards, historic squares, and a mix of architectural styles from Habsburg to Bourbon periods, with bustling streets and cultural landmarks.

location.description: Located in the heart of Madrid, bordered by Gran Vía to the north, Paseo del Prado to the east, and encompassing the historic core of the city.

history.overview: Originally founded as a Moorish fortress in the 9th century, later becoming the capital of the Spanish Empire under Philip II in 1561, with major development during the Habsburg and Bourbon periods.
history.significance: The historical and political center of Spain, showcasing the country's imperial past and cultural heritage.

practical_info.safety: Very safe during day and evening; normal precautions regarding pickpockets in tourist areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for museums and monuments; evening for dining and atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent - predominantly pedestrianized with limited vehicle access.

attractions.name: Royal Palace
attractions.description: Largest royal palace in Europe by floor area, featuring opulent rooms, art collections, and historic gardens.
attractions.appeal: Experience the grandeur of Spanish royalty through centuries of history and art.

attractions.name: Plaza Mayor
attractions.description: 17th-century square surrounded by historic buildings, featuring traditional restaurants and cafes.
attractions.appeal: Immerse yourself in Madrid's historic atmosphere while enjoying traditional cuisine.

attractions.name: Puerta del Sol
attractions.description: Historic square marking the center of Spain, featuring the famous clock tower and bear statue.
attractions.appeal: Experience the heart of Madrid and its New Year's Eve traditions.

dining.name: Casa Lucio
dining.known_for: Huevos rotos and traditional Madrid cuisine
dining.atmosphere: Historic restaurant with traditional decor and lively atmosphere.

dining.name: La Mallorquina
dining.atmosphere: Historic pastry shop with traditional decor.

activities.name: Historic Walking Tour
activities.description: Guided or self-guided tour through Madrid's historic streets and squares.

activities.name: Museum Hopping
activities.description: Visit multiple museums within walking distance, including the Prado, Thyssen, and Reina Sofía.

stay_here_if: You want to be within walking distance of main attractions.
You enjoy historic surroundings and cultural activities.
You prefer to immerse yourself in the heart of the city.
avoid_if: You're sensitive to noise (streets can be busy, especially during festivals).
You prefer modern accommodations with spacious rooms.
You're looking for a quiet, residential experience.
insider_tips: Visit the Royal Palace early morning to avoid crowds.
Many museums offer free entry on certain days - check schedules for significant savings.
The rooftop of the Círculo de Bellas Artes offers one of the best views of the city.

neighborhoods.name: Salamanca
neighborhoods.character: Upscale shopping and residential district featuring elegant 19th-century architecture, luxury boutiques, and sophisticated dining options.

location.description: Located northeast of the city center, bordered by Calle Serrano and Calle Velázquez.

history.overview: Developed in the late 19th century as Madrid's first planned expansion, designed by Carlos María de Castro.
history.significance: Represents Madrid's bourgeois expansion and remains one of the city's most prestigious districts.
notable_events: Construction of main streets and buildings

practical_info.safety: Very safe area with good lighting and regular police presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for shopping; evening for dining and atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with wide sidewalks and pedestrian areas.

attractions.name: Calle Serrano
attractions.description: Madrid's premier shopping street featuring luxury boutiques and international brands.
attractions.appeal: Experience high-end shopping in an elegant setting.

attractions.name: Plaza de Colón
attractions.description: Major square featuring the Columbus Monument and cultural centers.
attractions.appeal: Visit historic landmarks and cultural institutions.

attractions.name: Museo Arqueológico Nacional
attractions.description: National archaeological museum with extensive collections.
attractions.appeal: Explore Spain's archaeological heritage in a historic building.

dining.name: DiverXO
dining.atmosphere: Avant-garde dining space with theatrical presentation.

dining.name: Ramón Freixa Madrid
dining.atmosphere: Elegant dining room in a historic mansion.

dining.name: La Maruca
dining.known_for: Fresh seafood and traditional Spanish dishes
dining.atmosphere: Modern, stylish restaurant with traditional touches.

activities.name: Luxury Shopping Tour
activities.description: Explore the Golden Mile's luxury boutiques and designer stores.

activities.name: Architectural Walking Tour
activities.description: Self-guided tour of the district's elegant 19th-century buildings.

stay_here_if: You want luxury accommodations and upscale surroundings.
You enjoy high-end shopping and fine dining.
You prefer a sophisticated, quiet atmosphere.
avoid_if: You want to experience traditional Madrid nightlife.
You prefer more authentic local atmosphere.
insider_tips: Visit during sales season (January and July) for significant discounts.
Many restaurants offer business lunch menus at reduced prices.
The district's side streets often hide charming cafes and boutiques.

neighborhoods.name: La Latina
neighborhoods.character: Historic neighborhood with medieval streets, traditional tapas bars, and authentic Madrid atmosphere, featuring lively nightlife and cultural heritage.

location.description: Located southwest of the city center, featuring narrow medieval streets and historic architecture.
landmarks: Basílica de San Francisco el Grande

history.overview: One of Madrid's oldest neighborhoods, developed during the medieval period and later becoming a working-class district.
history.significance: Preserves Madrid's medieval heritage and traditional character while evolving into a popular entertainment district.

practical_info.safety: Generally safe; normal urban precautions advised at night.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Evening for tapas and nightlife; Sunday morning for Rastro market.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with pedestrianized streets and historic alleys.

attractions.name: El Rastro
attractions.description: Madrid's famous Sunday flea market with hundreds of stalls.
attractions.appeal: Experience traditional Madrid market culture and find unique souvenirs.

attractions.name: Plaza de la Paja
attractions.description: Medieval square with historic buildings and traditional atmosphere.
attractions.appeal: Step back in time in one of Madrid's oldest squares.

attractions.name: Basílica de San Francisco el Grande
attractions.description: Historic church with impressive dome and art collection.
attractions.appeal: Admire religious art and architecture in a historic setting.

dining.name: Casa Lucio
dining.known_for: Huevos rotos and traditional Madrid cuisine

activities.name: Tapas Tour
activities.description: Explore traditional tapas bars and local specialties.

activities.name: Rastro Market Experience
activities.description: Browse the famous flea market and experience local culture.

stay_here_if: You enjoy traditional tapas and nightlife.
avoid_if: You're sensitive to noise and crowds.
insider_tips: Visit El Rastro early morning to avoid crowds.
Many tapas bars offer free tapas with drinks during happy hour.
The area's side streets often hide the best traditional bars.
